points: A top-down thinker, with a notable ability to initiate, manage and collaborate on software projects.

items.title: Software Developer
details: Worked for a postdoctoral mentor doing mathematical research on resolving the identities of vessels at tracked locations in the water.
Developed components for a software system intended to put his research into practice, namely  services to eliminate vessel hypotheses given their static and dynamic attributes.
Engineered a software service that provides sea-ice and ocean-floor data at requested geographical locations and times, to eliminate hypotheses near the shoreline and in the arctic.
Served as the systems administrator of a supercomputer workstation running ArchLinux.

items.title: Software Developer
points: Developing software that compiles text into text-networks, to build an ontology on aging research from a stream of textbooks and journal articles.
Notes and source code available here.

items.headline: Ironbane - a FOSS MMORPG written entirely in JavaScript
points: Improved server architecture by partitioning the game's map into cells. Each cell owns a region of the map and is a concurrent actor that updates its AI only when players are inside of it.
Allows for a larger game world to be created.
Optimizes server performance for the intended gameplay experience.

items.headline: Starfall - a 3D space MMORPG demo
points: Supports logging in, cockpit-style controls and collision detection.

items.headline: Fitlings Pedometer Game - for Shad Valley Entrepreneurship Cup
points: Prototyped an Android game aimed at reducing obesity rates in youth.
Used the accelerometer found in Android devices to create a setting where the player has to walk in order to keep their avatar healthy.
Teammates created business plan and art assets.
Awarded 3rd place for Best Application of Scientific Principles.

items.headline: Titans-Server - server emulators for Universal Century Gundam Online
points: With Brian Burnett and Vince Macchia, reverse engineered the game's packet protocol.
Wrote server emulators in Java, allowing users to try the game again after the official service was cancelled in 2007.
